Package model

Class MapModel

java.lang.Object
model.MapModel
public class MapModel
extends java.lang.Object
class that defines all entities in the map (continents, countries, borders) and their operations
Version:
build 1
Author:
Rohit

    • addContinent

      public void addContinent​(Continent continent)
      method for adding a new continent on the map. If the map does not contain any continents, initialize map continents with an array list If the map does not contain a mapping of continents with associated countries, initialize the continent countries with a HashMap
      Parameters:
      continent -

    • addContinentCountries

      public void addContinentCountries​(Continent continent, Country country)
      method to input a new country into its associated continent If that particular continent does not exist in the mapping of continentCountries, nothing happens. If it does, add that country into the map (continentCountries) If the map does not have any borders set, initialize the border with a linked hash-map and add that country
      Parameters:
      continent -
      country -

    • addBorders

      public void addBorders​(Country mainCountry, Country neighbourCountry)
      method to add a neighboring country to the map of borders using mainCountry as search key
      Parameters:
      mainCountry -
      neighbourCountry -

    • validateMap

      public ResponseWrapper validateMap()
      Method for validating the map once created. It can produce the following message: 1. In map there are no continents 2. Continent Value is not good 3. Map is not created Properly 4. Duplicate Continent or Country Found in map 5. Countries Should be Atleast 2 in map 6. Country's Continent Data is missing 7. Country's Continent not available in the list 8. Border Data for Countries is not consistent with Countries that are added 9. Countries Border Missing 10. VALIDATION SUCCESSFUL
      Returns:
      alert for the specific message, either successful if not, what is the error message
